update.description:
Fixing paths related issues observed in Windows build: \(It is not a exhaustive list but the problems observed initially blocking Gazebo working for ROS on Windows.\)

* Forward slash path \(or mixing forward\\backward slash\) usage on OGRE is not properly translated to the actual path, so normalize them before passed to OGRE.
* Fix exception observed when passing a position out of range in SystemPaths::UpdateModelPaths, SystemPaths::UpdateGazeboPaths, and SystemPaths::UpdatePluginPaths.
* Fix the logic to automatically trim “lib” \(which should check the prefix “lib” matched before trimming it\) in Windows build in plugin.hh.
update.title: [Gazebo9] Fixing paths related issues on Windows build.

pull_request.title: [Gazebo9] Fixing paths related issues on Windows build.

pullrequest.title: [Gazebo9] Fixing paths related issues on Windows build.

content.raw:
CMake's documentation on `file(TO_NATIVE_PATH ...)` \([https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.14/command/file.html#to-native-path](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.14/command/file.html#to-native-path)\) mentions that:

> Always use double quotes around the `<path>` to be sure it is treated as a single argument to this command.

I think this is necessary to make sure that the path is not truncated if the `${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX}` contains spaces, that is not unusual in Windows \(the default `CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX` for example is `C:/Program Files`\).
content.html:
CMake's documentation on file(TO_NATIVE_PATH ...) (https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.14/command/file.html#to-native-path) mentions that:

Always use double quotes around the <path> to be sure it is treated as a single argument to this command.

I think this is necessary to make sure that the path is not truncated if the ${CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX} contains spaces, that is not unusual in Windows (the default CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX for example is C:/Program Files).

content.raw:
## CI results

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/775/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/1020/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1653/
* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2446/

there are a few style complaints reported by the Ubuntu builds related to line length > 80 characters. unfortunately, there is a bug in our jenkins system that doesn't display the style complaints on the website, but I can paste them here instead:

~~~
gazebo/common/Plugin.hh:169:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
gazebo/rendering/Heightmap.cc:506:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
gazebo/rendering/RTShaderSystem.cc:98:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc:623:  Lines should very rarely be longer than 100 characters  [whitespace/line_length] [4]
~~~
content.html:
CI results

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-nvidia/775/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/1020/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1653/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/2446/

there are a few style complaints reported by the Ubuntu builds related to line length > 80 characters. unfortunately, there is a bug in our jenkins system that doesn't display the style complaints on the website, but I can paste them here instead:

gazebo/common/Plugin.hh:169:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
gazebo/rendering/Heightmap.cc:506:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
gazebo/rendering/RTShaderSystem.cc:98:  Lines should be <= 80 characters long  [whitespace/line_length] [2]
gazebo/rendering/RenderEngine.cc:623:  Lines should very rarely be longer than 100 characters  [whitespace/line_length] [4]
